<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 348, 293]]<|/det|>
## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 154, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2021  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 359, 400]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 228, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 880, 604]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 634, 219, 649]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 728, 682]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 73, 599, 89]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 133, 561, 151]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 165, 240, 182]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 194, 384, 212]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(ax^{2} + bx + c = 0\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 212, 581, 248]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 271, 228, 288]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 291, 752, 330]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 344, 500, 380]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 409, 384, 427]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series \(u_{n} = a + (n - 1)d\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 432, 534, 464]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{1}{2} n(a + l) = \frac{1}{2} n\left\{2a + (n - 1)d\right\}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 486, 336, 504]]<|/det|>
Geometric series \(u_{n} = ar^{n - 1}\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 508, 428, 580]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{a(1 - r^{n})}{1 - r} (r\neq 1)\] \[S_{\infty} = \frac{a}{1 - r} (|r|< 1)\]  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 610, 594, 628]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 642, 156, 660]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 670, 583, 720]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc \mathrm{e}^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 765, 242, 782]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[403, 791, 594, 880]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C\] \[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\] \[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 92, 908, 419]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 435, 920, 472]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the graph of the cubic function \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\). The intercepts of the curve with the axes are all integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 483, 143, 502]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 483, 520, 502]]<|/det|>
Find the set of values of \(x\) for which \(\mathrm{f}(x) < 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 484, 920, 502]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 577, 146, 594]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 577, 376, 594]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(\mathrm{f}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 577, 920, 594]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 92, 99, 111]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 87, 144, 109]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 77, 792, 123]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\frac{\sqrt[3]{xy}\bigl(zy\bigr)^2}{\bigl(xz\bigr)^{-3}\sqrt{z}} = x^a y^b z^c\), find the exact values of the constants \(a, b\) and \(c\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[88, 490, 121, 508]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 490, 529, 511]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(5(2^{2p + 1}) - 17(2^p) + 3 = 0.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 490, 920, 509]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 144, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 609, 92]]<|/det|>
Write \(3 + 2\lg a - 4\lg b\) as a single logarithm to base 10.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 490, 146, 509]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 490, 489, 510]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(3\log_{a}4 + 2\log_{4}a = 7.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 490, 920, 509]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 79, 94, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\cot \left(2x + \frac{\pi}{3}\right) - \sqrt{3} = 0\), where \(-\pi < x < \pi\) radians. Give your answers in terms of \(\pi\). [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 500, 97, 519]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 495, 920, 523]]<|/det|>
Find the possible values of the constant \(c\) for which the line \(y = c\) is a tangent to the curve \(y = 5 \sin \frac{x}{3} + 4\). [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 97, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 70, 586, 91]]<|/det|>
## DO NOT USE A CALCULATOR IN THIS QUESTION.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 885, 138]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x) = 10x^{3} + ax^{2} - 10x + b\) , where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers, is divisible by \(2x + 1\). When \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(x + 1\), the remainder is \(-24\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 149, 144, 168]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 149, 379, 168]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(a\) and of \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 149, 920, 168]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 411, 146, 429]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 411, 665, 431]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) as the product of three linear factors.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 411, 920, 429]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 675, 144, 694]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 675, 574, 694]]<|/det|>
Write down the remainder when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 675, 920, 694]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[319, 88, 680, 237]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 255, 920, 292]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows triangle \(OAC\), where \(\overrightarrow{OA} = \mathbf{a}\), \(\overrightarrow{OB} = \mathbf{b}\) and \(\overrightarrow{OC} = \mathbf{c}\). The point \(B\) lies on the line \(AC\) such that \(AB:BC = m:n\), where \(m\) and \(n\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 303, 181, 322]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 301, 479, 322]]<|/det|>
Write down \(\overrightarrow{AB}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{b}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 303, 920, 322]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 349, 180, 368]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 348, 479, 368]]<|/det|>
Write down \(\overrightarrow{BC}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{b}\) and \(\mathbf{c}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 349, 920, 368]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 396, 181, 415]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 395, 492, 415]]<|/det|>
Hence show that \(n\mathbf{a} + m\mathbf{c} = (m + n)\mathbf{b}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 396, 920, 415]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 597, 144, 616]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 588, 180, 616]]<|/det|>
Given that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[255, 586, 544, 621]]<|/det|>
\[\lambda \binom{2}{1} +(\mu -1)\binom{-4}{7} = (\lambda +1)\binom{-4}{-2},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[544, 596, 920, 618]]<|/det|>
<form>find the value of each of the constants \(\lambda\) and \(\mu\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 613, 920, 632]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
A 5-digit number is made using the digits 0, 1, 4, 5, 6, 7 and 9. No digit may be used more than once in any 5-digit number. Find how many such 5-digit numbers are even and greater than 50 000.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 103, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 443, 146, 460]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 443, 920, 477]]<|/det|>
The number of combinations of \(n\) objects taken 4 at a time is equal to 6 times the number of combinations of \(n\) objects taken 2 at a time. Calculate the value of \(n\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 459, 920, 477]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[287, 81, 700, 384]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 400, 920, 452]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a circle, centre \(O\), radius \(12\mathrm{cm}\), and a rectangle \(ABCD\). The diagonals \(AC\) and \(BD\) intersect at \(O\). The sides \(AB\) and \(AD\) of the rectangle have lengths \(6\mathrm{cm}\) and \(4\mathrm{cm}\) respectively. The points \(M\) and \(N\) lie on the circumference of the circle such that \(MAC\) and \(NDB\) are straight lines.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 463, 144, 482]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 463, 673, 482]]<|/det|>
Show that angle \(AOD\) is 1.176 radians correct to 3 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 463, 920, 482]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 650, 146, 668]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 650, 470, 668]]<|/det|>

<label>10</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[87, 92, 897, 413]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 425, 920, 468]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the graph of the curve \(y = \frac{1}{(x + 2)^2} +\frac{3}{(x + 2)}\) for \(x > - 2\). The points \(A\) and \(B\) lie on the curve such that the \(x\)-coordinates of \(A\) and of \(B\) are \(- 1\) and \(2\) respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 495, 144, 515]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 495, 492, 515]]<|/det|>
Find the exact \(y\)-coordinates of \(A\) and of \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 495, 920, 514]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 636, 146, 655]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 635, 920, 680]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the shaded region enclosed by the line \(AB\) and the curve, giving your answer in the form \(\frac{P}{q} - \ln r\), where \(p\), \(q\) and \(r\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 655, 920, 675]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 106, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 102, 890, 375]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 392, 920, 475]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the velocity–time graph for a particle \(P\), travelling in a straight line with velocity \(v \mathrm{ms}^{- 1}\) at a time \(t\) seconds. \(P\) accelerates at a constant rate for the first \(10 \mathrm{s}\) of its motion, and then travels at constant velocity, \(30 \mathrm{ms}^{- 1}\) , for another \(15 \mathrm{s}\). \(P\) then accelerates at a constant rate for a further \(10 \mathrm{s}\) and reaches a velocity of \(60 \mathrm{ms}^{- 1}\). \(P\) then decelerates at a constant rate and comes to rest when \(t = 55\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 488, 181, 505]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 488, 468, 505]]<|/det|>
Find the acceleration when \(t = 12\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 488, 920, 505]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 580, 180, 598]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 580, 468, 598]]<|/det|>
Find the acceleration when \(t = 50\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 580, 920, 598]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 673, 180, 691]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 673, 579, 691]]<|/det|>
Find the total distance travelled by the particle \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 673, 920, 691]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 146, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 73, 918, 109]]<|/det|>
A particle \(Q\) travels in a straight line such that its velocity, \(\nu \mathrm{ms}^{- 1}\) , at time \(t\) s after passing through a fixed point \(O\) is given by \(\nu = 4\cos 3t - 4\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 120, 180, 140]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 117, 462, 141]]<|/det|>
Find the speed of \(Q\) when \(t = \frac{5\pi}{9}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 140]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 246, 181, 264]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 243, 781, 265]]<|/det|>
Find the smallest positive value of \(t\) for which the acceleration of \(Q\) is zero.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 247, 920, 266]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 477, 180, 496]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 476, 683, 497]]<|/det|>
Find an expression for the displacement of \(Q\) from \(O\) at time \(t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 476, 920, 495]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]
